Topic: Roll Call and Quorum Establishment
Summary: The roll call was conducted, and seven members were present, constituting a quorum.
Ordinance Number: N/A
Votes Summary:
- Vote 1: N/A
Decision/Key Actions: Quorum established with seven members present.

- Topic: Amendment of City Council Rule 56 regarding meeting procedures during COVID-19
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend City Council Rule 56 in its entirety, considering COVID-19, as provided in "Exhibit A".
- Ordinance Number: M-21-169
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - 7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT
    Vote 2: Amendment passed unanimously
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed with amendments to Rule 56 regarding meeting procedures during the COVID-19 emergency.
- Tags/Keywords: City Council, COVID-19, Rule 56, Amendment
- UID: e2059b8b-01fd-4ba1-9ff1-6ac795082000

- Topic: Communication from Theresa R. Becher, Council Research Officer, New Orleans City Council

- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance for Virtual Vehicle Sales
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the zoning ordinance to allow for virtual sales of vehicles and create a definition for Virtual Motor Vehicle Sales. It was adopted.

- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance for Wineries
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the zoning ordinance to impact all zoning districts that permit micro-breweries, micro-distilleries, breweries, and distilleries by-right or through conditional use. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33323 - 28695 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopted - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- Topic: Vacant Property Protection Program
- Summary: The ordinance aims to create the Vacant Property Protection Program, allowing the owner of a vacant and unimproved parcel of property to authorize the New Orleans Police Department to enter the property to arrest, remove, and detain persons believed to have committed criminal trespass. It was continued to the meeting of 6/17/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33246
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: N/A - (Continued to the meeting of 6/17/21)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 6/17/21

- Topic: 4200 Burgundy Street Servitude Agreement
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into an agreement to grant a servitude to an adjacent property owner for encroachments on/over portions of the public right-of-way located at 4200 Burgundy Street. The ordinance sets the minimum price and terms of the servitude agreement and declares that such use will not interfere with the public right-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: 33320
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Servitude Agreement, Public Right-of-Way, Property Owner, Mayor, New Orleans
- UID: 556c9ff3-216d-4595-8a03-d74ccb9894c2

- Topic: 2730 - 34 St. Claude Avenue Servitude Agreement
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into an agreement to grant a servitude to an adjacent property owner for encroachments on/over portions of the public right-of-way located at 2730 - 34 St. Claude Avenue. The ordinance sets the minimum price and terms of the servitude agreement and declares that such use will not interfere with the public right-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: 33321
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Clarification of Pardon Power for Marijuana Possession
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to clarify the pardon power of the Mayor and City Council with respect to authorizing the prospective pardon of marijuana possession.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,328
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The details of the voting outcome are not provided in the summary.

- UID: c8b1d767-9c17-4c39-b53b-40147c9866c3

- Topic: Amendment of Smoke Free Air Act and Marijuana Smoking Regulations
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain sections of the City of New Orleans Code related to the Smoke Free Air Act and marijuana smoking regulations. It seeks to authorize NOPD to enforce the Smoke Free Air Act only via summons and to prohibit the smoking of marijuana outside of a private residence. The ordinance also excludes marijuana testing from certain drug testing programs and clarifies the discretion of policy officers not to issue summons for marijuana possession in certain circumstances.
- Ordinance Number: 33,329
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - Continued to the meeting of 7/1/21 and referred to the Criminal Justice Committee
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 7/1/21 and referred to the Criminal Justice Committee for further consideration. Technical correction is needed.
- Tags/Keywords: Smoke Free Air Act, marijuana, NOPD, drug testing, Criminal Justice Committee
- UID: e44c200b-2f05-4e37-833b-734362ab16ed

- Topic: Appropriation of Federal Grant Funds
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend Ordinance No. 28,550 M.C.S. to appropriate federal grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Mayor’s Office of Homeland Security for Federal Emergency Management Agency reimbursement related costs.
- Ordinance Number: 33,331
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - Continued to the meeting of 7/1/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 7/1/21 for further consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: Federal grant funds, Intergovernmental Transfers, Homeland Security, FEMA reimbursement
- UID: e44c200b-2f05-4e37-833b-734362ab16ed

- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A

- Topic: Request for City Planning Commission to conduct public hearing to amend Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: Motion M-21-191, introduced by Councilmember Banks, requested the City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing to amend the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to incorporate recommendations from the 2019 "Billboard Study." The recommendations included implementing "Option 2" to provide trade incentives for nonconforming billboards to digitize in exchange for removal, along with considerations for conversion of billboards with two sides/faces, out of residential and historic districts, illumination and density standards. The motion was adopted with 7 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-191
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion M-21-191 to amend the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance was adopted by the council.
- Tags/Keywords: City Planning Commission, Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance, Billboard Study, Motion M-21-191
- UID: 33d76643-2bbe-4064-a19d-40212271daa9

- Topic: Amendment and reordainment of Lease Agreement for NSA-EB property
- Summary: Ordinance CAL. NO. 33,325, introduced by Councilmember Gisleson Palmer, aimed to amend and reordain an existing ordinance to restructure the minimum annual rent due to the City for the Lease Agreement with EMDRC Partners, LLC for the NSA-EB property. The ordinance sought to delete and replace SECTION 2 of the existing ordinance to address the minimum annual rent and other aspects of the Lease Agreement. The outcome of the vote was not provided in the summary.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,325
- Votes Summary: N/A
